meanings.definition: To come to live permanently in a foreign country.
meanings.sent1: Many families are immigrating to the United States for a better life.
meanings.sent2: She is immigrating to Canada next month to start a new job.
meanings.sent3: The penguins joked about immigrating to the warmer South Pole for the winter.
meanings.sent4: His ideas were immigrating into the minds of the students, sparking creativity.
meanings.sent5: The concept of immigrating brings a sense of adventure and new beginnings.

meanings.definition: To enter and usually become established; especially: to come into a country of which one is not a native for permanent residence.
meanings.sent1: The birds are immigrating to this area due to the favorable climate.
meanings.sent2: They are immigrating from Europe to start a business in the USA.
meanings.sent3: The idea of immigrating to the moon for a vacation seemed absurd but exciting.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for music was immigrating into every aspect of her life.
meanings.sent5: The thought of immigrating to a new land filled her with hope and anticipation.
